intro: Endiusa loiseleurii, commonly known as the Loiseleur's endiusa, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its delicate, palmate leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
